ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I will recommend it to other students!Our seminar is really helpful. It facilitates me with an understanding of early Chinese texts, new ways to conduct research (distant reading, for instance), presentation skills and writing skills. And I enjoy it more and more. Previously, I could say literally nothing in class. But I believe I am doing better and better.
Would recommend to any student interested in early China or fundamentals of Chinese philosophy. Not for students without pre-existing knowledge of classical Chinese and contemporary philosophy.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It gives me new ways to think about late imperial Chinese literature. It's not the knowledge but theway of thinking that really counts.
